pullRequest.body:
This is the follow-up of the PR #12498. It is used in the definition of linearly disjointness (#9651).

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks, and is labeled with `awaiting-review`.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.TensorProduct.Subalgebra`|1157|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ comm_trans_rTensorBot`

`+ lTensorBot_symm_apply`
`+ lTensorBot_tmul`

`+ mulMap'_surjective`
`+ mulMap_bot_left_eq`
`+ mulMap_bot_right_eq`
`+ mulMap_comm`
`+ mulMap_range`
`+ mulMap_tmul`
`+ mulMap_toLinearMap`
`+ rTensorBot`
`+ rTensorBot_symm_apply`
`+ rTensorBot_tmul`
`+ rTensorBot_tmul_one`
`+ rank_sup_le_of_free`
`+ val_mulMap'_tmul`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash

```
</details>

</details>

Thanks!

ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9961455827/job/27522991560)

:v: acmepjz can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Canceled.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9965046145/job/27534561717)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9965046145/job/27534561256)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
This generalizes to `A : Type` where `[IsScalarTower R A S]` or similar, right?
Maybe yes; I'll check it later.

I'm afraid that this is not true, for example `R=A=Z, S=F_p`. You may require that the map `A -> S` is injective. But in my opinion this is the same as `A : Subalgebra R S`. Another problem is that this isomorphism is defined in terms of `Submodule.lTensorOne`, which has no such generalizations (yet).

Should this not be called `lTensorOne` to match the submodule version? That matches the pattern of naming defs after their behavior not their type.

bors r-


bors d+

Originally, `Submodule.lTensorOne` is about `1 : Submodule R S`. But according to discussion https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/12498#discussion_r1586280439 it is changed to `âŠ¥ : Subalgebra R S` (which as a submodule is equal to `1 : Submodule R S`) since it makes the statement and proof a little bit easier.

But for subalgebras, we don't have `1 : Subalgebra R S` but only `âŠ¥ : Subalgebra R S`, so in my opinion it's better to talk about `lTensorBot` since it is for `âŠ¥ : Subalgebra R S`. What's your opinion?

Ah, fair enough. I realize now that if I wanted to name this after its map, `1 âŠ—â‚œ[R] a`, then this would be `lTmulOne`; but `Tensor` is indeed the name of the type, and so your name was consistent after all.

Could you add something like

> This is the `Subalgebra` version of `Submodule.lTensorOne`.

to this docstring, and the `r` version, before merging?
Sure, will be added in a few minutes.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(LinearAlgebra/TensorProduct/Subalgebra): some linear maps induced by multiplication for subalgebras
